column1: Man måste lära sig krypa innan man kan gå.
column2: Learn to walk before you can run.
column3: It is necessary to learn the basics before progressing to more advanced things.

column1: Magen mättas förr än ögat.
column2: The eye is bigger than the belly.

column1: Man får ta saken i egna händer.
column2: One must take matters into one’s own hands.
column3: If something is bugging you, take care of the problem yourself.

column1: Man får ta seden dit man kommer.
column2: When in Rome, do as the Romans; When among wolves you must howl.

column1: Man har aldrig roligare än vad man gör sig.
column2: You never have more fun than what you do.
column3: How much fun you have depends on what you choose to do.

column1: Man hör vad man vill höra.
column2: None is as deaf as he who does not want to hear.

column1: Man lär så länge man lever.
column2: One learns as long as one lives.

column1: Man lär sig av misstagen.
column2: One learns from mistakes.

column1: Man kan inte både äta kakan och ha kakan kvar.
column2: You can’t have your cake and eat it too.
column3: You cannot do two mutually incompatible things at the same time.

column1: Man kan inte lära gamla hundar sitta.
column2: You can’t teach an old dog new tricks.
column3: Old people are often unwilling or unable to learn new skills or adopt new methods.

column1: Man måste rätta munnen efter matsäcken.
column2: Cut your cloak according to your cloth.
column3: You have to match your revenues with your expenses.

column1: Man saknar inte kon förrän båset är tomt.
column2: You never miss the well till it runs dry.
column3: We tend to take some things for granted, and become aware of their value only when they are no longer available.

column1: Man ska inte bjuda bagarbarn på bullar.
column2: One should not offer cinnamon rolls to baker’s children.

column1: Man skall inte byta häst mitt i strömmen.
column2: Don’t change horses in midstream.
column3: It is often wise not to quit an undertaking already begun.

column1: Man ska inte buga för dumheten bara för att den är gammal.
column2: Might is not always right.
column3: Authorities, old customs and old institutions might be in the wrong.

column1: Man ska inte döma hunden efter håren.
column2: Never judge a book by its cover; Never judge by appearances.
column3: Do not make a judgment about something or somebody on the basis of outward appearance alone.

column1: Man ska inte gjuta olja på elden.
column2: Don’t add fuel to the fire.
column3: One should not make a bad situation even worse by an improper remark.

column1: Man ska inte gråta över spilld mjölk.
column2: Do not weep over spilled milk.
column3: Dwelling on past mishaps will only waste your time.

column1: Man tröttnar aldrig på att arbeta för sig själv.
column2: A man does not feel a burden of his own choosing.

column1: Man är alltid sig själv närmast.
column2: Skin is nearer than the skirt.
column3: When you make decisions you choose which is best for yourself rather than taking into consideration ethical or ideological convictions.

column1: Medan gräset gror, dör kon.
column2: While the grass grows the steed starves.

column1: Mister du en så står dig tusen åter.
column2: There are plenty of fish in the sea.
column3: Usually used concerning broken hearts. There is also a continuation for it: Väljer du en så är det tusen som gråter. (If you choose one, a thousand will cry.).

column1: Morgonstund har guld i mund.
column2: The early bird catches the worm.

column1: Mycket vill ha mer.
column2: Much would have more.
column3: When you have much of something, you will want even more.

column1: Måla inte fan på väggen.
column2: Don’t paint the devil on the wall.

column1: Många bäckar små, blir till en stor å.
column2: Small streams make great rivers.

column1: Många hugg fälla eken.
column2: Many strokes cut down great oaks.
column3: A difficult task, e. g. removing a person/group from a strong position, or changing established ideas cannot be done quickly. It can be achieved gradually, by small steps, a little at a time.

column1: Människan spår, men gud rår.
column2: Man proposes, God disposes.
